comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Princess Sophie Helene Cecilie of Schönburg-Waldenburg (21 May 1885 - 3 February 1936) was the wife of Prince William of Wied. With her husband's ascension to the Albanian throne she became the Princess of Albania (Albanian: Princeshë e Shqipërisë). Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Princess_Sophie_of_Sch%C3%B6nburg-W... [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5051566232/]

comment.author: 13900953@N02
comment._content: This is MAria Inmakulata of Austria Tuscany en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Archduchess_Maria_Immakulata_of_Aus... Here with her husband Rubert of Wurtemberg

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Belle epoque 1900s: thank you for identifying this woman. She does appear to be Archduchess Maria Immakulata of Austria.  We will add her fuller name to the information when we update the database.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: On taking another look at this image, the title of the photo indicates that it probably shows Princess Sophie Helene Cecilie of Schonburg-Waldenburg who was the wife of Prince William of Wied, Prince of Albania. We will include this information with "probably" in the description, until more information becomes available. Maria Immakulata of Austria and Princess Sophie do look very similar. Another photo of the "Prince and Princess of Albania" is here: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5051566232/

comment.author: 13900953@N02
comment._content: Thanks for the info, but she s Maria Inmakulata. Another picture of her with husband where you can see both ladies have same profile img218.imageshack.us/img218/1733/robertwandmariain.jpg The jewels she s wearing are of diamonds and rubies and where a present to the current duchess of Wurtemberg, Diane (nee Diane D`Orleans). www.royal-magazin.de/german/wuerttemberg/wurtemberg-rubie... BTW , i ve found lots of mislabeled images at the LOC site. Where i can send the corrections?.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Belle Epoque: I agree that the woman in the Bain image looks more like Archduchess Maria Immakulata of Austria, so the Bain caption is incorrect. Thank you for your information and for the interesting photo of the current duchess of Wurtemberg wearing Maria Immakulata's jewlery. We will add her name to the description when we update. If you have information on other images in the Prints and Photographs Online Catalog, you can contact us through "Ask a Librarian" : www.loc.gov/rr/askalib/ask-print.html We appreciate your help!
